unnormalised: The NH44, India's longest national highway, spans approx. 3,745 km, connecting Srinagar to Kanyakumari. Traveling this route offers a glimpse into the diverse landscapes and cultures of India. Did you know, the Yamuna Expressway, designated NH94, cuts down travel time between Delhi and Agra to just 3-4 hrs?

unnormalised: Many state highways also play vital roles. For instance, SH17 in Karnataka connects major cities and is approx. 430 km long. Always check road conditions, esp. during monsoon season (June-Sept), as landslides and flooding can cause significant delays.
normalised: Many state highways also play vital roles. For instance, S-H seventeen in Karnataka connects major cities and is approximately four hundred and thirty kilometer long. Always check road conditions, especially during monsoon season (June to September), as landslides and flooding can cause significant delays.

unnormalised: Planning a road trip? Remember that toll charges apply on most national highways. The average toll cost can range from Rs. 2 to Rs. 4 per km for cars. You can pay using FASTag for seamless travel or use cash at toll booths, but FASTag is generally preferred. Also, ensure your vehicle is well-maintained and carry necessary documents like driver's license and RC book, plus insurance.

You can pay using F-A-S-T-ag for seamless travel or use cash at toll booths, but F-A-S-T-ag is generally preferred. Also, ensure your vehicle is well-maintained and carry necessary documents like driver's license and R-C book, plus insurance.

unnormalised: Driving on Indian roads, especially in rural areas, requires patience and caution. Watch out for speed limits which vary from 40 kmph in cities to 100 kmph on expressways, and respect local driving habits. A well-planned trip can be an unforgettable journey across Incredible India!
